Key Arguments: The legislation creates a division between 'Viewpoint Elites' and 'Deplorables', favoring government-approved entities.
The bill uses intimidation tactics against citizens and digital platform providers.
The legislation is costly to administer and lacks clarity on funding.
The bill threatens religious freedom by potentially classifying religious beliefs as misinformation.
Definitions of 'Harm' and 'Serious Harm' are inadequately defined, allowing for potential misuse.
The legislation will have a chilling effect on free speech.
Free speech is a more effective solution for misinformation than the proposed legislation.
Main Themes: Advocacy for free speech as a solution
Notable Quotes: This Bill divides citizens into two classes: Those whom the Govt. deems trustworthy... and those whom the Govt. deems cannot be trusted.
This Bill introduces a substantial moral, financial and political division of citizens into two classes.
This Bill intimidates the Deplorables by dis-empowering them.
Without amendment, this Bill will result in situations where citizens' religious lives will be monitored and reported.
Definitions within this Bill have been left dangerously broad, so much so there is a high likelihood they will be used as political bludgeons.
Free speech is the most inexpensive, time-tested and equitable solution for solving misinformation and disinformation.
